title: Why Is LoL Becoming Anime Focused?
body:
I've been playing LoL since season 2, and I have noticed the significant shift in theme.

Every new skin these days is anime focused, rather than the Western focus the game used to have before being sold to 10cent.
This confuses me, as anime is Japanese, not Chinese.

For example, I bought the 'Grungy Nunu' skin because I grew up with Sesame St, and now it's just something completely different.

This really isn't an anime style game, so why alter the cosmetics to make it look like one?

replies.body:
Because it sell well, and is appealing to the majority of the player base. 

At the end of the day, money speak; A business will capitalise on the current trend, race has no relevant.
^ Best possible explanation. If something sells well, why stop making more of it?
Whilst I am sad we lose Sesame Street Nunu and Willump, it's not exactly anime, since the skin is a reference to Pixar's Monsters Inc, which is still more or less American but what's splitting hairs.
